system.description:
A burglar needs a decent set of tools to do their “job”, and they’ll construct their own toolkits from readily-available tools.

This normally includes a set of lockpicks for dealing with common locks, a pry bar for forcing open windows and hatches, and a few small measures of oil or grease to silence noisy hinges or ease a stiff mechanism.

Most kits contain a few other small, cheap items, added based on the experiences and needs of each burglar.
